According to @AAF, EOs from President Biden's first year in office added more than $201 billion in regulatory costs & 131 million hours in new paperwork yearly. 

Doubling down on bureaucracy is not how you grow an economy.

Read more in @highlandcopress:
https://t.co/HSlc5XEvi5

The Dec. 2021 derecho hit Nebraskans harder than any December storm in more than a century. Joining @SenatorFischer and the other members of our delegation, I‚Äôve asked President Biden to approve @GovRicketts‚Äô disaster declaration and provide federal assistance. https://t.co/YSUfs2RWTL

This decision from @FERC to raise new barriers to energy independence is another disconcerting example of how the Biden administration has turned a blind eye to the needs of American families to push its out-of-touch agenda. https://t.co/70SBtoYNmR

Congressional approval exists to prevent a failure of accountability.
 
Because the stakes are high for us and our allies, I joined @RepGallagher and more than 160 of my colleagues in warning President Biden against walking blindly into JCPOA 2.0. https://t.co/pptZAis49A

Inflation is at a 40-year high.

Meanwhile the Biden administration wants to spend more money for the sake of spending more money.

We need to turn away from the policies at the root of our economic crisis. https://t.co/63UWakFeyN

The Biden administration has some explaining to do. 

Less than one year ago, Democrats sold their $1.9 TRILLION ‚Äústimulus‚Äù package as COVID relief, then wasted the majority of it on pet projects. Now they want more? No.

The American people deserve better.https://t.co/KIELvDTIfJ

If American families and businesses can balance their budgets ‚Äì along with nearly every state ‚Äì the federal government should do the same. Our children, and our children‚Äôs children, cannot afford for us to wait.

Read more in my column in @sbstarherald‚¨áÔ∏è

https://t.co/bnRMTII3Mm

Whether it‚Äôs fueling their cars or feeding their families, Americans everywhere are paying more for the goods and services they need. 
 
Inflation is at its highest level in 40 years. 
 
One thing is clear: President Biden‚Äôs policies are failing American families.

It's National #SchoolChoiceWeek. Nebraskans have worked hard to keep our schools open, but other states can't say the same. Parents, not politicians, know their children best. This is why I support #SchoolChoice & enhancing options like education savings plans. https://t.co/pLrnHmyeP9

I will always stand with American workers & job creators. https://t.co/VlzC2Uyvw9

President Biden campaigned as a centrist who would defeat COVID & improve America's world standing. Instead, his actions have shown a commitment to a left-wing agenda, undermining America's families. My column here: https://t.co/51OeXXDSmh

Americans, like those who braved the cold in Washington today, have been gathering for nearly a half century to stand for the unborn. Our commitment, hope, and enthusiasm to choose life is enduring because we know every life is precious and made in the image of God. #WhyWeMarch

I joined more than 180 of my colleagues, including the entire Nebraska delegation, in opposing this mandate at the Supreme Court because Congress didn‚Äôt empower OSHA to implement broad public health mandates. I am glad the Supreme Court agreed. 2/2

While I am disappointed the Supreme Court didn't overturn the HHS vaccine mandate, today's ruling blocking the Biden admin's OSHA mandate is a big win for American workers, American employers, and our constitutional system of checks and balances. 1/2 https://t.co/adQW5a7jR5

Great news! India agreed to allow imports of US pork and pork products after we‚Äôve worked nearly two decades to address the trade barriers U.S. pork faced. But we can't stop here. New markets for American and #NE03 goods are key to boosting our economy. https://t.co/kxE7Auqrqx

Very disappointed SCOTUS declined to review the lower court decision blocking EPA‚Äôs Year Round E15 Rule. I first introduced legislation to allow E15 sales year-round in 2015, and I will continue fighting to lift this regulation and ensure more consumer choice at the fuel pump. https://t.co/iEoZtKOSHA

We need strong democratic partners worldwide to help defend Western ideals of liberty & human rights. Clarity & consistency in securing our prerogatives & standing with those who aspire to freedom, democracy, & self-determination is vital. My column here: https://t.co/WrB5l0clwg

It has been a privilege to serve alongside Devin Nunes on the Ways and Means Committee as we fought to reform our tax code, open markets for agriculture producers, and ensure every American can connect with economic opportunity. I wish him every success in his future endeavors.
Small businesses like Rodriguez Brothers Custom Processing are the foundation of rural communities across #NE03. My column here: https://t.co/dx1M3YpDCJ
Senator Bob Dole was a true statesman, #WWII veteran, and champion of midwestern values. He proudly demonstrated humble leadership and was a pillar of the Greatest Generation. He will be missed.
I opposed today‚Äôs short-term spending bill because it is a symptom of Democrats‚Äô refusal to govern. My full statement: https://t.co/FBF6rhrMim
I was glad to join my colleagues in carrying on the Nebraska Breakfast tradition this morning!

As food prices continue to increase, updated guidance is needed to ensure fair tax treatment of food donations by retailers and restaurants. Yesterday I joined @RepJimmyPanetta in asking Treasury to prioritize these rules and ensure food banks can access every available resource.

The statutory deadline for finalizing RVO levels is today, yet @EPA remains silent. Once again the Biden Admin is failing #NE03 producers and the biofuels industry by not giving them the transparency and certainty they are owed.
Vaccines save lives, but the Biden administration‚Äôs unilateral vaccine mandates are doing more harm than good. My column here: https://t.co/R61CRdCo9V

https://t.co/cnvLmicJk8

We must reaffirm Mexico‚Äôs commitment to biotech provisions in USMCA and ensure President L√≥pez Obrador‚Äôs policies to ban certain biotechnology does not come to fruition. I joined @RepJimCosta in urging the Biden Admin to hold Mexico accountable. More here: https://t.co/7tZXluC2Ri

Today is¬†National Rural Health Day; a reminder of the unique challenges rural patients and providers face every day. I am committed to ensuring telehealth services and access to quality health care are available to #NE03.

I highlighted @CoffeeZabuni as a great example of how Kenyans and #NE03 alike can benefit from more open markets and positive trade relationships in the Ways and Means subcommittee hearing on US-Africa trade opportunities today. Watch my remarks here: https://t.co/vShaEEoG8G

Each year on November 11th, our nation celebrates the men and women who have defended our freedoms. My column paying tribute to our veterans here: https://t.co/sHNSUSGkGR

The latest CPI report is out ‚Äì gas prices surged 12.3% and food prices jumped another 1% in Oct, bringing us to a 49.6% increase for gas and 5.4% for food prices over the last year. With Thanksgiving right around the corner, record inflation is the last thing Americans need.

https://t.co/h0YgP0jpqL

The reality of President Biden‚Äôs supply chain crisis is half-built, new farm equipment sitting idle, car dealerships vacant, and store shelves empty. Our economy cannot go on like this. My column here: https://t.co/9ru8HFaOT8

Government vaccine mandates don't solve problems; they create them. I cosponsored bills to block President Biden‚Äôs unilateral abuse of power. Federal mandates only make our workforce problems worse without convincing anyone that getting an FDA-approved vaccine is the best choice.

President Biden‚Äôs IRS financial reporting rules would place a new strain on local banks and credit unions while threatening the privacy of every American. Yesterday I joined @RepTomEmmer and 200 colleagues in calling on Treasury Secretary Yellen to withdraw the proposal. https://t.co/i71LBJEJbE

The Biden Admin‚Äôs proposed bank reporting requirements would be a massive burden for community banks and credit unions, targeting nearly every American with a job. I joined my @WaysandMeansGOP colleagues today in opposing this onerous mandate. Learn more: https://t.co/ZK9aRyM21H

Open enrollment for Medicare has officially started. This open enrollment season I encourage Nebraskans to take advantage of the resources available to find the plan that fits them best. My column here: https://t.co/GdTbEjXl2G
Today we celebrate #WorldFoodDay by recognizing the farmers and ranchers in #NE03 who play a pivotal role in nourishing not only the nation, but the world.

My office offers great opportunities for high school and college students to serve our state. Read my column to learn more about internship programs and my Youth Advisory Council: https://t.co/L2XfFFIkPj

It was a privilege hosting @ConsulmexOmaha for an Ag Tour yesterday. We made stops at the Bayer Waco seed Corn facility, McLean Beef & Triple S Farms where we discussed the importance of the USMCA & the impact of biotech policies on the US ag sector and US and Mexican consumers. https://t.co/S229uFr2Db
We have a clear crisis at our southern border. It is time the President and his administration take action. My column here:¬†https://t.co/3hS7UFEto9

Rural health providers have shown how successful temporary COVID telehealth authorizations have been in improving rural access to care, which is why I introduced a bill to make these rules permanent and continue to enhance access for #NE03. More here: https://t.co/dj97VwHDWD
This National Manufacturing Day I want to thank all the innovative and driven manufacturers across #NE03, each and every one of you is essential to our workforce and economy! #MFGDay21

Democrats‚Äô take it or leave it approach to governing has gone on long enough. I spoke on the House floor urging against their partisan bill to raise the debt ceiling, which would give them a blank check to spend more, instead of addressing our nation‚Äôs spending problem. https://t.co/l4oe2MyLhs

Agricultural trade between the U.S. and Mexico benefits everyone. I had a great discussion with the Mexican Farm Bureau‚Äôs President Juan Cortina and VP Rogelio Garc√≠a Moreno on Mexico's policies on GMOs & glyphosate and the need for Mexico to approve pending biotech permits. https://t.co/jTcd84a3V5

To help manufacturers as they face numerous challenges in today‚Äôs economy we need to ensure our tax code recognizes the cost of doing business. I introduced H.R. 5371, the Permanently Preserving America‚Äôs Investment in Manufacturing Act, last week to do just that.
This week, as a government shutdown looms, Democrats must seek out bipartisan solutions. My column here: https://t.co/XkzzomdSF8

Walter Scott‚Äôs devotion to bettering the lives of every Nebraskan and our state as a whole will never be forgotten. His work will live on through his impact and his legacy. My prayers go out to the Scott family.

It is time President Biden abides by his campaign promise and upholds the Renewable Fuel Standard. Read the letter I sent to the White House with my Biofuels Caucus Co-Chairs @RodneyDavis & @RepDustyJohnson addressing concerning RVO rumors: https://t.co/y6MJV9Gn6u

Stepped-up basis repeal wasn‚Äôt in the tax package Ways and Means Democrats forced through committee last week, but other attacks on family farms and small businesses were. The fight continues. My column here: https://t.co/e79Sxve4Es

This #SmallBusinessWeek serves as a crucial reminder of the important role small businesses and entrepreneurs play as the backbone of our economy. Now more than ever, we must serve our struggling small businesses by connecting them with workers across #NE03 and the nation.

My amendment would keep our farmers and ranchers from being penalized at the loss of a loved one with the death tax. Unsurprisingly, Democrats rejected my amendment. View my remarks here: https://t.co/SKi8BTZxLv https://t.co/cKSrdjkTSY

I am saddened by the news of former Omaha Mayor and Douglas County Commissioner Mike Boyle‚Äôs passing. His commitment to serving Nebraskan‚Äôs will always be remembered. My prayers are with Mike‚Äôs family.
On September 11, 2001, the United States of America was changed forever. My column on the 20th anniversary of this harrowing day here: https://t.co/865Gin7WnJ

20 years ago, our country and the world were forever changed. May we #NeverForget the courage and sacrifice of the first responders and thank our servicemembers and veterans for putting their lives on the line so we may enjoy freedom. https://t.co/jhC62HjHCT
Today, Nebraskans all across our state welcome home Corporal Daegan Page. We will always remember the service and sacrifice of this young man who was taken far too soon.
Great seeing this @Windows log-in screen from a staff PC today. Nice choice, @Microsoft! https://t.co/ltnZ4rzPXl
As we emerge from the pandemic, economic growth should be better and spending should be lower. Instead, Democrats are doing the opposite. My column here: https://t.co/gJHIY0hy6c

Congratulations to @bh_bobcats student Libby Macklin who was selected as the #NE03 Congressional Art Competition winner! Her drawing will be displayed in the halls of the U.S. Capitol. https://t.co/LhgTkW5pRl
Always enjoy the opportunity to visit the #NeStateFair. Thank you to all who come together annually to demonstrate the strengths of our great state. https://t.co/42ryAxovNc
It was great meeting with @CPI_coop leadership this week to get a tour of their new fertilizer facilities and learn more about how they support #NE03 ag producers. https://t.co/ska6s4iI2x

I am disappointed in the recent district court ruling in Arizona vacating the Navigable Waters Protection Rule. NWPR provided much needed clarity for state and federal governments to protect our water, and our rural communities cannot afford for it to be withdrawn.

I am proud to support this legislation to award the 13 U.S. service members who lost their lives in Afghanistan the Congressional Gold Medal. These brave men and women exemplified true valor in the face of imminent danger and our country will never forget it. https://t.co/a4dwuqi4S6

I was glad to join @VernBuchanan and @RepBradWenstrup in reintroducing my bill to minimize uncertainty throughout the health care marketplace and provide appropriate oversight of CMMI so innovation in health care can continue to develop. Learn more here:
https://t.co/VmO17n31UI
The last plane carrying American troops has departed from Kabul. Our fellow Americans and our allies have been left behind and stranded. This is a tragic day.

We must not remove any more of our troops from Afghanistan until we have succeeded in evacuating all Americans. Our troops, our citizens, and our allies deserve better than this. My column here: https://t.co/PZV1SECw0K

Great piece from @WSJ on the importance of supply chains to manufacturing in our economy. If we want to get our economy back to 100%, we must ensure needed parts are being made and delivered on time so completed goods can be sold to consumers both here and abroad. https://t.co/eT7AeXEwGZ

My prayers are with the family of Corporal Daegan William-Tyeler Page tonight. This brave young man served the Marine Corps, our country, and our state heroically. May we always remember his sacrifice.
We cannot stand by while the President of the United States creates an American hostage situation in Afghanistan.

For this reason, I support HR 5071 to prohibit President Biden from fully withdrawing our troops from Afghanistan until all Americans have been safely evacuated. If we allow the administration to set an arbitrary deadline, there will be little hope for the Americans left behind.
President Biden‚Äôs failure as commander-in-chief is causing chaos on the world stage. We cannot stand by while the lives of American citizens, our Afghan allies, and our military are still at risk.

As more information becomes available it is unfortunately clear the situation in Kabul is significantly worse than we hoped. The lives of 12 US service members have been lost to these attacks. My heart goes out to these families. https://t.co/mzgFnLaSqU
The terror attacks in Kabul today are truly devastating. God bless our U.S. Marines. I pray for the victims, their families, and those who remain stranded in this ongoing tragedy.
Thanks to the @Ne_AgriBusAssoc for the opportunity to address your summer convention yesterday. I appreciated hearing more about your vital work to ensure Nebraska remains a top ag production state!

Now more than ever, our priority in Congress must be empowering small businesses to reopen and hire workers, not penalize job creation, incentivize Americans to stay home, and continue to grow inflation.
Our ongoing inflation and workforce crises are a direct result of President Biden‚Äôs failed economic plan, and this budget doubles down on their failing agenda.

This is a clear last-ditch effort to ram it through in the least accountable fashion possible. This tactic shows how unpopular the resolution is with the Speaker‚Äôs own caucus, let alone the American people.
Speaker Pelosi paved the way for Democrats to push through their multi-trillion-dollar social spending package today by using a procedural gimmick to deem their budget resolution passed.
To say I am incredibly disappointed by Speaker Pelosi and House Democrats‚Äô continued manipulation of the legislative process to cater to their own agenda is an understatement.

ICYMI: Strong ag policy is vital to ensure Nebraska can compete globally. I appreciate my colleague G.T Thompson, the lead Republican on the House Ag. Committee, for his interest in #NE03 as we work to improve federal ag policy. See the release here: https://t.co/5r03XhHj8B https://t.co/6lX5mTUyLQ
